metadata.title: CVE-2015-3812 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Multiple memory leaks in the x11_init_protocol function inepan/dissectors/packet-x11.c in the X11 dissector in Wireshark 1.10.xbefore 1.10.14 and 1.12.x before 1.12.5 allow remote attackers to cause adenial of service (memory consumption) via a crafted packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3812` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwireshark11 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwiretap8 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwscodecs2 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwsutil9 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
tshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark-common - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark-qt - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1').
